bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 147 (Wednesday, September 28, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. VALADAO:H.R. 6290.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1: The Congress shall havepower To lay and collect Taxes, Duties, Imposts and Excises,to pay the Debts and provide for the common Defence andgeneral Welfare of the United States; but all Duties,Imposts, and Excises shall be uniform throughout the UnitedStates.[Page H6107]

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend for one year the credit for biodiesel and renewable diesel used as fuel.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.title: Biodiesel and Renewable Diesel Incentive Extension Act of 2016

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend through 2018:

  • the income tax credit for biodiesel and renewable diesel used as fuel,
  • the excise tax credit for biodiesel mixtures,
  • the payments that are equivalent to the biodiesel mixture excise tax credit,
  • the excise tax credit for alternative fuels,
  • the excise tax credit for alternative fuel mixtures, and
  • the payments that are equivalent to the alternative fuels excise tax credit.

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain tax incentives for biodiesel, renewable diesel, and alternative fuels.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain tax incentives for biodiesel, renewable diesel, and alternative fuels.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain tax incentives for biodiesel, renewable diesel, and alternative fuels.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
